title: American imports of corn 2001 to 2019
summary: This line chart has an x axis representing Year and a y axis representing Imports in million bushels, with a total of 19 data points. The chart has 8 significant trends.
The longest trend is slightly negative which exists from 2015 to 2012.
Conversely, the next significant trend is extremely positive which exists from 2012 to 2009.
Likewise, the next significant trend is slightly negative which exists from 2019 to 2017.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2017 to 2015.
On the other hand, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2009 to 2007.
Contrarily, the next significant trend is moderately positive which exists from 2007 to 2005.
Additionally, the next significant trend is moderately negative which exists from 2005 to 2003.
Conversely, the next significant trend is moderately neutral which exists from 2003 to 2001.
gold: This statistic shows imports of corn in the United States from 2001 to 2019 . According to the report , U.S. corn imports amounted to approximately 57 million bushels in 2016 , down from 68 million bushels the previous year .
